repnme.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Social Sector Adjustment
            Credit (SOSAC) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Adjustment Operation
            Project (SOSAC) for Kyrgyz Republic achieved its major
            objectives fully; the Bank performance was rated as highly
            satisfactory, however the borrower performance was only
            satisfactory. Relevance of the project objectives was high,
            adopting policies, regulations, and structural improvements
            to modernized the Pension Fund and reduce its deficits was
            key to help the Government improve its fiscal performance
            and in establishing a system consistent with a market
            economy. In the area of Social Assistance (SA), a study
            performed under SOSAC aimed to assess the extent to which
            the means testing formula for SA benefits was effective in
            reaching its intended beneficiaries, and develop
            recommendations on how to improve benefits reaching the
            poor. Lessons learned a) difficulties of the SOSAC Technical
            Assistance (TA) Program played a part in the decision to
            establish a full TA investment operation to support
            implementation of the Consolidated Structural Adjustment
            Credit; b) performance of the implementing agency was
            satisfactory, however the agency had many other
            responsibilities, and limited capabilities, e.g., for
            procurement and donor coordination, which somewhat reduced
            its effectiveness. The SOSAC was not a politically popular
            project in the Kyrgyz Republic.

repnme.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Social Sector Adjustment
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Adjustment Credit
            Project seeks to: 1) establish a fiscally sustainable
            pension scheme that will provide a stronger linkage between
            contributions and benefits, while providing a minimum level
            of guaranteed support to prevent poverty; 2) improve the
            effectiveness of labor market interventions under conditions
            of high unemployment; and 3) implement well-targeted and
            fiscally sustainable programs to alleviate poverty. The
            credit will be released in two tranches. If successfully
            implemented, the program is expected to result in reductions
            in the payroll contribution rate, alleviating the
            significant burden on enterprises and on employment, and
            opening the way for a transition to a partially funded
            system. The primary risk of the project is that policy
            reversals could undermine the medium term fiscal
            sustainability of the pension system. Other risks include
            lower than expected collections and weak institutional
            capacity within the Social Fund. To mitigate this risk, the
            Social Fund is undertaking an aggressive contributor
            registration drive and has agreed on a comprehensive plan of
            coordination with the Tax Inspectorate.

docna.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Social Sector Adjustment
            Credit Project
